errors.error_description: The package name in the pip install command is incorrect; it uses an underscore instead of a hyphen, which will cause the installation to fail.
The `add_pagination(app)` call is placed before the `app` object is instantiated, which will raise a `NameError` because the `app` variable does not exist yet.
correction_candidates: Move `add_pagination(app)` to be the last line in the script.
Place `add_pagination(app)` immediately after the `users` list is defined.
Move `add_pagination(app)` to the line just after `app = FastAPI()`.
Move `add_pagination(app)` to the line just before the `return paginate(users)` statement.
errors.golden_answer: Move `add_pagination(app)` to be the last line in the script.

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that the package is compatible with Python 3.6, while the original text specifies Python 3.8 and higher, which could cause compatibility issues for users on older Python versions.
correction_candidates: Change "Compatible with Python 3.6 and higher." to "Compatible with Python 3.8 and higher.".
Change "Compatible with Python 3.6 and higher." to "Compatible with Python 3.7+".
Change "Compatible with Python 3.6 and higher." to "Requires Python version 3.8.".
Change "Compatible with Python 3.6 and higher." to "Compatible with any Python 3 version."
errors.golden_answer: Change "Compatible with Python 3.6 and higher." to "Compatible with Python 3.8 and higher.".

errors.error_description: The type hint for the return value in the quickstart example uses incorrect syntax (`Page<UserOut>`) for generics in Python. It should use square brackets (`Page[UserOut]`).
Added specific version constraints that may cause compatibility issues
Changed installation method from pip to conda which may not have the package available
Added unnecessary dependencies (django, flask) that are not required for fastapi-pagination
